Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration

Source: R/Main.R
franchestyn.Rd

Runs the FraNchEstYN model The function prepares inputs (weather, management, parameters, reference) and launches the executable. Users do not manage paths or config files manually.

Usage

franchestyn(
  weather_data,
  management_data,
  reference_data = NULL,
  cropParameters = NULL,
  diseaseParameters = NULL,
  fungicideParameters = NULL,
  calibration = "disease",
  start_end = c(2000, 2025),
  apikey = NULL,
  franchy_message = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

weather_data

A data frame of daily or hourly weather for one site only. The function will detect if input is daily or hourly. Column names are matched case-insensitively, ignoring spaces, underscores, and dashes.

Date columns (mandatory):

provide the combination of year, month, day (and optionally hour for hourly data).

Meteorological variables:

Mandatory:

  • Daily inputs: tmax (max temperature, °C), tmin (min temperature, °C), precipitation (mm d-1).

  • Hourly inputs: temp (air temperature, °C), precipitation (mm d-1).

Radiation or Latitude (one required):

  • Radiation (rad, solar, solarrad, …) [MJ m⁻² d⁻¹]

  • Latitude (lat, latitude, phi) [decimal degrees]

If radiation is missing, it will be estimated from latitude and day length.

Optional variables (used if present, estimated otherwise):

  • Relative humidity: rh, humidity, relhumidity, relativehumidity (hourly), rhmax/rhx and rhmin/rhn (daily)

  • Leaf wetness: not required — computed internally from humidity > 90% or rainfall ≥ 0.2 mm/h.

Unit expectations:

  • Temperature: °C

  • Radiation: MJ m⁻² d⁻¹; if missing, estimated

  • Precipitation: mm d⁻¹ (daily) or mm h⁻¹ (hourly)

  • Humidity: % (0–100)

management_data

A data frame with management information for the same site as weather_data. Column matching is case-insensitive; spaces/underscores/dashes are ignored and internally normalized to snake_case.

Required columns:

  • crop — character (e.g., "Wheat").

  • sowingDOY — integer DOY in [1, 366]. Values outside this range trigger a warning.

  • year — either an ISO year (YYYY) or the string "All".

    • If numeric: the row applies to that calendar year only.

    • If "All": the row is treated as a default program for all years.

Optional columns:

  • treatment — character with one or more fungicide dates separated by commas/semicolons (e.g., "12 Feb; 28 Feb" or "Mar 15, Apr 03").

How fungicide dates are handled:

  • Dates in treatment are parsed using flexible formats (e.g., "12 Feb", "Feb 12", "12 February", "February 12").

  • When year is a specific YYYY, that year is used for parsing. When year == "All" or missing, the treatments are computed for all simulated years.

reference_data

An **optional** data frame with observations; **required when** calibration != "none". Column names are matched case-insensitively and trimmed of spaces; common aliases are accepted (see below).

Minimum requirement for disease calibration (calibration %in% c("disease","crop", "all")

  • Must contain a disease severity column under one of the accepted aliases: DiseaseSeverity, dissev, or disease. Values should be fractional in [0,1] (not percent).

Time alignment (recommended for meaningful calibration/metrics):

  • Year + DOY: year/yr together with doy/day_of_year/dy/d.

Optional observational variables (used if present):

  • Light interception: fint, f_int, lightInterception, light_int, lightinterception

  • Biomass (AGB): agb, above_ground_biomass, biomass, abovegroundbiomass, wtop

  • Variety/cultivar: variety, cultivar, cv

  • Yield (attainable): YieldAttainable, YieldUnlimited, YieldPotential, Yield, wgrn, GrainYieldPotential

  • Yield (actual): YieldActual, YieldDiseased, YieldAct, yieldact, YieldLimited, GrainYieldLimited

cropParameters

A named list of crop parameters (e.g. cropParameters$Wheat). Each parameter is itself a named list with fields: description, unit, min, max, value, and calibration (logical). Several predefined sets are already included in the package (see data(cropParameters)).

diseaseParameters

A named list of disease parameters (e.g. diseaseParameters$Septoria), with the same structure as cropParameters. Predefined sets are included in the package (see data(diseaseParameters)).

fungicideParameters

An optional list of fungicide parameters (e.g. fungicideParameters$protectant), structured like crop and disease parameters. A predefined set is provided in the package (see data(fungicideParameters)).

calibration

Character. What to calibrate or simulate:

  • "none" – run simulation only

  • "crop" – calibrate the crop model

  • "disease" – calibrate the disease model

  • "all" – calibrate both crop and disease model

Matching is case-insensitive.

start_end

Numeric vector of length 2. Start and end years for simulation (default: c(2000, 2025)). Must satisfy start_end[1] <= start_end[2].

apikey

Optional string. API key for enabling LLM-based commentary (used when franchy_message = TRUE). If not provided, the simulation runs normally without AI-generated summaries.

The key must be generated from the OpenRouter platform at https://openrouter.ai/. Once obtained, pass it here as a string, e.g.: apikey = "sk-or-v1-...".

Notes:

  • If the key is invalid or expired, the function will skip the LLM commentary and emit a warning.

franchy_message

Logical. If TRUE, the function will attempt to generate a Frankenstein-themed ("Franchestyn-flavored") commentary at the end of the run using a Large Language Model (LLM). Requires a valid apikey from https://openrouter.ai/. Default is FALSE.

Notes:

  • If apikey is missing, invalid, or expired, no commentary will be generated (the simulation itself still runs normally).

  • Output text is returned in the list element $spooky_message.

...

Advanced options (hidden from standard use). Currently supported: iterations (integer; default 100), only relevant when calibration != "none".

Value

(Invisibly) a list containing structured outputs, summaries, diagnostics, and any updated parameters. The structure includes:

  • outputs — raw and summarized simulation results:

    • simulation: the full daily simulation output as a data frame.

    • summary: a grouped summary by GrowingSeason, Site, and Variety, including:

      • Mean daily max/min temperatures: AveTx, AveTn

      • Mean daily max/min relative humidity: AveRHx, AveRHn

      • Total precipitation, radiation, and leaf wetness: TotalPrec, TotalRad, TotalLW

      • AUDPC: AUDPC

      • Max disease severity: DiseaseSeverity

      • Max attainable and actual yields: YieldAttainable, YieldActual

      • Absolute and percent yield loss: YieldLossRaw, YieldLossPerc

      • Max AGBAttainable and AGBActual

  • diagnostics — calibration metrics and visual diagnostics (if calibration was run):

    • metrics: error metrics (e.g., RMSE, MAE, R²) per variable

    • calibration: a list with:

      • tables: data frames showing default and calibrated parameter values with bounds

      • plots: ggplot2 facet plots comparing default vs calibrated vs bounds (crop and disease)

  • parameters — parameter lists after applying calibration results (if any):

    • crop: updated crop parameter list

    • disease: updated disease parameter list

  • spooky_message — optional text returned from a Frankenstein-themed LLM summary (if franchy_message = TRUE and apikey provided)

Model output CSVs are written into the outputs/ folder by the FraNchEstYN executable.

Details

- Only one site is supported per run. - Column name matching is case-insensitive and tolerant to spaces, underscores, and dashes.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Store your OpenRouter key in an env var first, e.g.:
# Sys.setenv(OPENROUTER_API_KEY = "sk-or-v1-...")

franchestyn(
  weather_data        = weather_df,
  management_data     = mgmt_df,
  reference_data      = ref_df,
  cropParameters      = cropParameters$Wheat,
  diseaseParameters   = diseaseParameters$Septoria,
  fungicideParameters = fungicideParameters$protectant,
  calibration         = "all",
  disease             = "Septoria",
  start_end           = c(2010, 2020),
  apikey              = "your-openrouter-api-key", #start with sk-or-v1-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx....
  franchy_message     = TRUE,
  iterations          = 200
)
} # }
